title: Ticket #4170: missing job ClassAd attributes in the manual
description:
A user noticed that there were some job attributes not documented in the manual: 

DiskProvisioned
CpusProvisioned
MemoryProvisioned
<name>Provisioned

These pair up with the job attributes Request<name>. They don’t appear in the job ClassAd on the schedd, only in the job ClassAd that’s written in the job’s execute directory while the job is running. They indicate how much of each machine resource has been allocated to the job. For statically partitioned slots, they will match the amount of resource given to the slot when the startd started. For partitionable slots, they will be based on the job’s Request<name> attributes, but may be larger to make the partitioned slot more likely to be reusable for additional jobs. In all cases, they should be equal to or greater than the job’s Request<name> attributes.
check_ins: 2015-Jan-12 10:52   Check-in [42165]: add definitions of some missing job attributes (that are in the job's ClassAd on the execute machine as the job runs, but not in the schedd) #4170 (By Karen Miller )
creator: smoler
